listing.description: An exceptionally spacious and immaculately presented characterful property, parts of which are believed to date to circa 1730. Located in the delightful rural village of Wardlow with superb far reaching views over a rolling open countryside. Standing in approximately three acres, together with a successful cattery business, a separate 1 bedroom studio and a two storey stone outbuilding. The main accommodation offers five bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, delightfully spacious sitting room, dining room, good size farmhouse style dining kitchen and a family room/study. There is ample off road parking, spacious gardens and a paddock extending to approximately 1.7 acres. The property is within catchment of the highly regarded Lady Manners School. Wardlow is a small village set in the heart of the Peak District National Park surrounded by open countryside yet with commuting distance of Sheffield and Manchester. The towns of Bakewell and Buxton are approximately 9 miles from Wardlow and Chesterfield approximately 14 miles. Entering the property via a hardwood entrance door with glazed panel which opens to:Reception Hallway 20'7 x 7'3 (6.27m x 2.21m)With side aspect casement windows, exposed beam to the ceiling and a pair of feature arched exposed stone doorways. There are a pair of built-in cloak cupboards with hanging space, central heating radiator with thermostatic valve and telephone point. A batten door with thumb latch opens to:Ground Floor Shower Room 7'1 x 5'10 (2.16m x 1.78m)With a rear aspect casement window with views over the gardens and open fields. The room has ceramic tiles to the floor and suite with off-set quadrant shower cubicle with mixer shower having hand held and overhead shower sprays, Victorian style pedestal wash hand basin and matching close coupled w.C. The room is illuminated by halogen down light spotlights. Over the hand basin is a shaver point. The room has an extractor fan and ladder style radiator.From the reception hallway an arched topped batten door with thumb latch opens to:Sitting Room 42' x 15'7 (12.80m x 4.75m)A split-level room with a central feature double sided fireplace in rustic stone with a raised hearth, housing a log burning stove. The room has stone flags to the floor and exposed beams to the ceiling. The upper part of the room has side aspect casement windows and a glazed entrance door with wing windows opening to a delightful enclosed the courtyard to the side of the property. A staircase rises to the first floor and to either side of the fireplace, openings lead to the lower part of the room having floor to ceiling double glazed windows with commanding views over the gardens and open countryside that surrounds the village and a glazed entrance door opening to the courtyard. The room is illuminated by table lamp points and there is a television aerial point with sky facility and a telephone point.Dining Room 15'10 x 15'1 (max) (4.82m x 4.6m)Having exposed beams to the ceiling with a heavy central beam, side aspect casement window overlooking the courtyard. The room has a feature fireplace with natural stone and a cast iron insert housing an open grate. There are illuminated display niches, feature exposed rustic stonewalls, wall lamp points and a central heating radiator with thermostatic valve.From the reception hallway a batten door with thumb latch opens to:Inner Hallway 8'2 x 4'4 (2.49m x 1.32m)With a front aspect casement window overlooking the gardens. The room has ceramic tiles to the floor and batten door opening to:Utility Room 8'4 x 4'1 (2.54m x 1.24m)With a front aspect casement window, quarry tiles to the floor, space and connection for an automatic washing machine and space and vent for a tumble dryer.From the inner hallway an opening leads to: Dining Kitchen 15' x 14'10 (4.57m x 4.52m)A spacious farmhouse style dining kitchen having dual aspect casement windows with heavy exposed lintels, quarry tiles to the floor and exposed beams to the ceiling with a heavy central beam. The kitchen is fitted with a good range of bespoke hand painted units with cupboards and drawers set beneath a polished granite work surface with a matching upstand, There are wall mounted storage cupboards, open display shelves and an under mounted Belfast style porcelain sink with mixer tap and flexible vegetable spray. Fitted within the kitchen is a Range Master cooker with 5-ring ceramic hob, double oven and grill over which is an extractor fan. The cooker is available by separate negotiation. Concealed within a cupboard is space and connection for a dishwasher. The room has a feature fire opening with a raised stone hearth housing a log burning stove. There is a television aerial point with sky facility, ample space for a family dining table and the room is illuminated by wall and centre light points. A stable style batten door with thumb latch opens to:Rear Entrance Lobby 9'4 x 7'7 (2.84m x 2.31m)Having dual aspect casement windows overlooking the gardens and a stable style entrance door opening onto the enclosed courtyard. There are quarry tiles to the floor following through from the kitchen and a range of storage cupboards, one of which provides space for a freezer. Sited within the room is the Potterton Kingfisher gas fired boiler which provides hot water and central heating to the property.From the kitchen a further batten door with thumb latch opens to:Family Sitting Room 15' x 12'3 (4.57m x 3.73m)With dual aspect casement windows, one of which has a fitted window seat. There are exposed beams to the ceiling with a heavy central beam and a feature fire opening with an exposed stone surround and raised stone hearth with a steel canopy. The room is illuminated by wall lamp points and there is a shallow built-in storage cupboard and display niche. The room has a central heating radiator with thermostatic valve and a ¼ turn staircase rising to bedroom four.From the sitting room a staircase rises to:First Floor Galleried Landing 15'6 x 7'10 (4.72m x 2.39m)Open to the apex of the roof and having exposed roof timbers and an access door into the eaves of the roof where there is ample storage space. A batten door with thumb latch opens to:Master Suite Dressing Room and En-Suite 13'11 x 6' and 15'6 x 7' (max) (4.24m x 1.83 and 4.72m x 2.13m)An 'L' shaped room having a good range of built-in wardrobes providing hanging space. The room has a side aspect window overlooking the courtyard. Bathroom suite comprising slipper shaped standalone bath set upon lions' paw feet with Victorian style mixer taps and hand held shower spray, Victorian style wash hand basin, low level w.C. And matching bidet. The room is illuminated by halogen spotlights and there is a shaver point, central heating column style radiator with thermostatic valve and heated towel rail. A broad opening leads to:Bedroom One 16'3 x 14'7 (4.95m x 4.44m)Built into the shape of the roof with floor to ceiling gable end double glazed windows taking advantage of the superb far reaching views. There is a further side aspect casement window overlooking the courtyard. The room has a rustic exposed stonewall, cast iron column style central heating radiators with thermostatic valves, television aerial point with sky facility and table lamp points.From the landing a batten door with thumb latch opens to:Bedroom Two 9'6 x 8'6 (2.9m x 2.59m)Open to the apex of the roof with exposed roof timbers having a low level side aspect casement window. There is a wall mounted wash hand basin, en-suite lavatory and central heating radiator with thermostatic valve.Bedroom Three 15'3 x 13'3 (4.65m x 4.04m)With a side aspect window overlooking the courtyard with a fitted window seat. There are exposed roof purlins and a good range of built-in wardrobes providing hanging space and storage shelving. The room is illuminated by table lamp points and there is a central heating radiator with thermostatic valve. A batten door with thumb latch opens to: Family Bathroom 14'10 x 7'11 (4.52m x 2.41m)A Jack 'n' Jill family bathroom with a side aspect casement window with views over the village and open countryside. There are exposed beams to the ceiling and a suite with panelled bath with Victorian style mixer taps and hand held shower spray, pedestal wash hand basin with mirror fronted bathroom cabinet over, shaver point and close coupled w.C. There are a pair of ladder style towel central heating radiators with thermostatic valves and sited within the room is an airing cupboard housing the hot water cylinder and having slatted linen storage shelving. A batten door with thumb latch opens to:Bedroom Four 15'3 x 13'6 (4.65m x 4.11m)Having a staircase which descends to the family room, side aspect window, exposed beams to the ceiling and central heating radiator with thermostatic valve. An access hatch opens to a boarded loft space and a further batten door with thumb latch leads to:Bedroom Five 11'7 x 7'10 plus Alcove 3'1 x 2'10 (3.53m x 2.39m plus 0.93m x 0.86m)The room has side aspect casement windows, exposed beams to the ceiling and built-in storage cupboard with hanging space and shelving. There is a central heating radiator with thermostatic valve.OutsideThe property is approached via a gated driveway which opens out to provide ample parking for several vehicles. To the rear of the property is a large are of garden mainly laid to lawn with borders stocked with a good variety of flowering plants designed to give colour and interest throughout the year. To the side of the property is a delightful courtyard enclosed by stone walls and flanked by the barn. To the far side of the barn is a second driveway giving access to the road and the studio. The main drive continues down the side of the garden to the cattery where there is a further area of garden and beyond the cattery is a paddock.Cattery 58'10 x 15' and 35'2 x 14'5 (17.93m x 4.57m and 10.71m x 4.39m)A purpose built 'L' shaped building with under floor heating throughout, floor to ceiling windows over looking the garden and individual cat houses to cater for forty plus cats. Included in the building is a Reception room 14'4 x 13'6 (4.37m x 4.11m) Having dual aspect windows; the rear window overlooking the paddock, reception desk and storage units with stainless sink, gas fired boiler, central heating radiator and separate telephone line. Utility Space 6'6 x 6'6 (1.98m x 1.98m) With a side aspect window, space and connection for a washing machine and tumble dryer. There is a deep industrial sink, dual flush close coupled w.C., storage shelving and central heating radiator.Barn 13'11 x 10'5 (4.24m x 3.17m)A two storey, stone built barn having power and lighting. With a traditional external stone staircase to the first floor. The building is suitable for a variety of uses subject to necessary consents.StudioA stone built self contained annex offering one bedroom, open plan living dining kitchen and bathroom. Ideal for use as dependant relative accommodation, work from home space, leisure suite etc.ServicesWater, electricity and gas are connected to the property. These particulars are produced in good faith with the approval of the vendor but they should not be relied upon as statements or representations of fact and they do not constitute any part of an offer or contract.

Fees


If you wish to apply to rent a property please observe the following procedure.
Rowcliffes charge the following fees in respect of administration and references:
Single Applicant - £100 (inc vat) Two Applicants - £200 (inc vat) Each additional applicant thereafter - £100 (inc vat).
A tenancy will be offered to you subject to contract and more specifically, subject to the following conditions:
• A fully completed application form has been submitted together with the appropriate fee.
• Payment of £200 (minimum) Holding Fee to reserve the property.
• You will be asked to pay this at the same time as the Application Fee.
• The landlord has accepted the offer.
• A satisfactory search has been carried out by an independent credit referencing agency (details on request).
• Satisfactory references have been obtained.
If your application is rejected prior to acceptance and/or seeking references, all monies are refundable. If your application is accepted (subject to references) you will be required to pay a minimum of £200 as a Holding Fee, upon receipt of which the property will be reserved for you. In some instances in order to reserve a property you may be asked to pay a higher Holding Fee or occasionally the full Deposit. If you are successful then upon commencement of the tenancy the Holding Fee will be used as part of your first rent payment to the landlord.
Once you have been provisionally accepted by the landlord (subject to references and contract) the Application Fee and Holding Fee (and Deposit if taken) become non-returnable unless the landlord withdraws the property due to their own unforeseen circumstances. If you choose to withdraw after acceptance, or undeclared adverse information is uncovered during referencing, then you will forfeit all fees (plus a reasonable proportion of the Deposit, if taken, which reflects the landlord's lost rent for the period between provisional acceptance and the date of rejection).
Before moving in to a property payment of the first months rent and deposit must be made by bank transfer, or cash . Funds must be cleared before keys can be released.
If in any doubt as to what is included within the let (i.E. Furniture, appliances etc.) you should seek further clarification prior to submitting your application.
You may be asked to provide a guarantor in some cases. Please note a guarantor fee of £60 (inc vat) per guarantor would then be payable.
The tenancy you are applying for is a fixed term.
Details of our fees will be provided again within the application form Which all applicants must complete and sign as standard.

listing.description: LocationBeltonville Farm is situated in a highly attractive position within the Peak District National Park and lies equi distance (5.20 miles) between the spa town of Buxton and the market town of Bakewell. The towns between them offer a wide and varied range of shopping, dining and recreation facilities. The village of Tideswell lies 1.30 miles to the north and itself offers a wide range of amenities, more so than the average village.To locate the property, from Bakewell take the A6 towards Buxton. After approximately 6.40 miles take the B6049 towards Tideswell. Continue along this road for approximately 2.30 miles where Beltonville Farm lies on the left hand side and will be clearly identified by our For Sale board.DescriptionBeltonville Farm offers a wonderful opportunity to purchase a highly productive dairy farm that has undergone significant investment to the infrastructure in the past few years. This has included a new cubicle shed, cow tracks and reseeding resulting in a property that is suited to dairy production from day one. The sale arises as a result of the current owners moving to a larger farm.The farmhouse was converted approximately 20 years ago and is subject to an Agricultural Occupancy Restriction. The property is well maintained and provides comfortable living accommodation.In particular, the accommodation comprises; Hallway with Cloakroom, having WC and handbasin. The Lounge/ Dining Room has efficient wood burning stove and stairs to the first floor with understairs store. The Farmhouse Kitchen has a stable door to the outside, a range of fitted units and steps leading up to a Utility Room. A range of fitted units with plumbing are found, whilst this leads to a Rear Entrance Hall. Finally, a Farm Office has a desk and fitted shelves.On the first floor; a Landing gives access to all rooms including a spacious Master Bedroom. The second Bedroom is also a double, whilst the third is over the stairs and suited to single occupancy only. The bathroom has bath with separate shower cubicle, WC and handbasin and airing cupboard. A newly constructed conservatory also lies off the landing.A garden lies to the rear of the property.Also included is a Static Caravan that is let for the sum of £300 per month, and pays a separate council tax. The Loft (5) is also let for £300 per month.There is an impressive range of farm buildings on the property that are well suited to dairy production and the rearing of youngstock. listing.description: Rowcliffes - buxton. Viewing is essential. Standing in beautifully landscaped grounds extending to around 1.4 acres this exceptional detached residence offers superb accommodation on a grand scale. Comprising; five reception rooms including an orangery, fitted kitchen/breakfast room, A stunning indoor swimming pool complex with sauna, six good sized bedrooms (master suite with en-suite, balcony and gymnasium) and two further bathrooms. Externally the gardens enjoy a superb open aspect towards the Cavendish Golf Club and include a tennis court together with manicured lawns.Brief DescriptionAeolus is arguably one of the finest residences in the historic Roman Spa Town of Buxton, approached by a sweeping driveway the property is set within superbly landscaped grounds in a semi rural location overlooking the Cavendish Golf Club. Boasting panoramic views to the surrounding Peak District countryside and hills beyond, and offers extensive and well presented accommodation set over two floors and including; six good sized bedrooms (master suite with en-suite, gymnasium and private balcony), various reception rooms and a delightful leisure complex with indoor swimming pool, sauna, shower room and orangery.Externally the grounds include numerous lawned areas with interspersed walkways, a tennis court with seating area and mature plantings, as previously mentioned the property enjoys a pleasant aspect over the golf course and surrounding countryside.LocationThe Roman Spa Town of Buxton famous for its mineral and spring water sits amongst some of the most beautiful countryside in England, being on the edge of the Peak District National Park whilst being accessible to the cities of Manchester, Sheffield & Derby. The town boasts magnificent architecture; some dating from the early 17th Century including the Crescent, a superb example of the Georgian period, built in 1780 for William Cavendish the Duke of Devonshire by John Carr of York. listing.letting_fees:
Fees


If you wish to apply to rent a property please observe the following procedure.
Rowcliffes charge the following fees in respect of administration and references:
Single Applicant - £100 (inc vat) Two Applicants - £200 (inc vat) Each additional applicant thereafter - £100 (inc vat).
A tenancy will be offered to you subject to contract and more specifically, subject to the following conditions:
• A fully completed application form has been submitted together with the appropriate fee.
• Payment of £200 (minimum) Holding Fee to reserve the property.
• You will be asked to pay this at the same time as the Application Fee.
• The landlord has accepted the offer.
• A satisfactory search has been carried out by an independent credit referencing agency (details on request).
• Satisfactory references have been obtained.
If your application is rejected prior to acceptance and/or seeking references, all monies are refundable. If your application is accepted (subject to references) you will be required to pay a minimum of £200 as a Holding Fee, upon receipt of which the property will be reserved for you. In some instances in order to reserve a property you may be asked to pay a higher Holding Fee or occasionally the full Deposit. If you are successful then upon commencement of the tenancy the Holding Fee will be used as part of your first rent payment to the landlord.

listing.description: DescriptionChapel Farm is situated in a wonderful elevated position with views over the Peak District National Park. It lies within the hamlet of Heathcote; a rural hamlet lying 1 mile to the east of the popular village of Hartington. Hartington offers many local facilities including a number of shops, café/tea room, public house and primary school. Further facilities are available in the spa town of Buxton, which lies approximately 9.50 miles to the north or the market town of Ashbourne which lies some 8.80 miles to the south. For those looking to commute, Heathcote is accessible to Derby, Chesterfield, Sheffield and Manchester.Chapel House FarmThe property on offer provides a wonderful opportunity to purchase a detached farmhouse that could be utilised as a 4 bedroomed house, or in its current configuration of a 2 bedroomed farmhouse and 2 bedroomed annex. Lying adjacent are a useful range of modern buildings that have been used for farming, but could be suited to alternative uses (subject to planning). The land lies to the south of the property and is suited to either mowing or grazing. It benefits from a secondary access.FarmhouseThe flexible accommodation is arranged over 2 floors. A rear entrance porch leads to a farmhouse kitchen, with range of fitted units and appliances. The adjoining dining room has an oak floor and multi fuel stove set in stone surround with stone hearth. Stairs lead to the first floor. The lounge also has an oak floor with exposed beams to the ceiling and electric fire in feature surround. The sun lounge is accessed through double doors and has patio doors to the garden. A shower room with tiled walls and floor completes the accommodation on the ground floor of the farmhouse but the annex has a separate front door that leads to a sitting room. This has stairs to first floor level and is open to a kitchen area. Leading from this can be found a shower room.The landing gives access to the annex at first floor level and also includes the master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, drawers and dressing table. There is a good sized second double bedroom. A large bathroom has bath, lower level WC, pedestal, handbasin and shower cubicle.A secondary staircase from the sitting room in the annex leads to the first floor where can be found bedroom three, with dressing area, and bedroom four.Extensive gardens lie to the front of the property which affords fine views over the surrounding countryside. A breeze block shed provides a useful garden store and measures 12.40m x 5.57m.Farm BuildingsThe property has a useful range of outbuildings. The property currently has an operator’s licence for one vehicle and trailer. A workshop (17.5m x 6.6m and 13.4m x 4.3m) has twin roller shuttered doors and inspection pit. Adjoining is four bay cattle shed/ loose housing (18.8m x 13.5m). Adjoining this is a five bay portal framed shed providing loosing housing (20.0m x 12.2m) and adjoining that a further cubicle shed/ loose housing and covered muck hole measuring 28.0m x 17.2m. There are also areas of hard standing and an open silage pit.LandThe land lies to the south of the property and is all laid to grass and in the whole suited to mowing or grazing. Knowl Cottage is currently used as a holiday let along with the two smaller cottages, Dove and Manifold, however it could easily be used as a family residence, as it has been in the past, perhaps in conjunction with use as a guest house. The cottages have high occupancy levels and good rental rates therefore they currently offer profitable holiday letting business. Knowl Cottage: The accommodation is over two floors with the front door leading into an entrance hall with staircase rising to the first floor. To the right of the hall is the sitting room (14' x 12' 11") with beamed ceiling, working fireplace with Inglenook and stone mullioned windows. To the left of the hall is the well fitted kitchen-dining area (12' 9" x 14' 3") which overlooks the street. To the first floor are three double bedrooms each with good sized en suite bath/shower room. The third bedroom gives an insight into the past with sight of the Cruck and ceiling beams. Both of these cottages, like Knowl, have beamed ceilings and benefit from central heating. There is a large ancillary room in the courtyard recently converted to become a dedicated sky sports room for shared use by the guests of the three cottages.Dove CottageDove Cottage is the right hand side of the two cottages with the front door opening into the sitting room with fireplace. Fees


If you wish to apply to rent a property please observe the following procedure.
Rowcliffes charge the following fees in respect of administration and references:
Single Applicant - £100 (inc vat) Two Applicants - £200 (inc vat) Each additional applicant thereafter - £100 (inc vat).
A tenancy will be offered to you subject to contract and more specifically, subject to the following conditions:
• A fully completed application form has been submitted together with the appropriate fee.
• Payment of £200 (minimum) Holding Fee to reserve the property.
• You will be asked to pay this at the same time as the Application Fee.
• The landlord has accepted the offer.
• A satisfactory search has been carried out by an independent credit referencing agency (details on request).
• Satisfactory references have been obtained.
If your application is rejected prior to acceptance and/or seeking references, all monies are refundable. If your application is accepted (subject to references) you will be required to pay a minimum of £200 as a Holding Fee, upon receipt of which the property will be reserved for you. In some instances in order to reserve a property you may be asked to pay a higher Holding Fee or occasionally the full Deposit. If you are successful then upon commencement of the tenancy the Holding Fee will be used as part of your first rent payment to the landlord.
Once you have been provisionally accepted by the landlord (subject to references and contract) the Application Fee and Holding Fee (and Deposit if taken) become non-returnable unless the landlord withdraws the property due to their own unforeseen circumstances. If you choose to withdraw after acceptance, or undeclared adverse information is uncovered during referencing, then you will forfeit all fees (plus a reasonable proportion of the Deposit, if taken, which reflects the landlord's lost rent for the period between provisional acceptance and the date of rejection).
Before moving in to a property payment of the first months rent and deposit must be made by bank transfer, or cash . Funds must be cleared before keys can be released.
If in any doubt as to what is included within the let (i.E. Furniture, appliances etc.) you should seek further clarification prior to submitting your application.
You may be asked to provide a guarantor in some cases. Please note a guarantor fee of £60 (inc vat) per guarantor would then be payable.
The tenancy you are applying for is a fixed term.
Details of our fees will be provided again within the application form Which all applicants must complete and sign as standard.

listing.description: LocationMine Cottage is situated in the Peak District National Park, within the beautiful Perry Dale off the minor road linking the hamlet of Old Dam with Perryfoot.The property is 1.2 miles from the villages of Peak Forest and Sparrowpit and is within 6 miles of both Castleton and Edale. Peak Forest is only 5.3 miles from Chapel en le Frith, 5.6 miles from Buxton and 10.7 miles from Bakewell. Both Chesterfield and Sheffield are within 21 miles and Peak Forest is only 27 miles from the centre of Manchester.DescriptionMine Cottage offers a rare opportunity to buy a small holding in such an attractive position within the Peak Park. The stone built cottage is on the flanks of the beautiful and largely unknown limestone valley, Perry Dale.The property comprises a four bedroom two storey detached dwelling overlooking Perry Dale, together with a range of farm buildings offering potential of alternative uses subject to the appropriate consents. In addition are the surrounding fields and woodland, in all totalling 5.8 acres. A further 10.7 acres of grassland may be available by way of separate negotiation, and should this be of interest please do speak to the agent.The Cottage is constructed of coarsed limestone with gritstone dressings, tiled roof over and uPVC double glazing throughout. Generally the property appears in good condition. The accommodation can be briefly summarised as follows;Ground Floor;entrance enclosed porch (1.71m x 0.97m)Accessed through the uPVC front door, the carpeted Hall provides access to both of the principal ground floor rooms and has under stairs storage.Kitchen (3.51m x 3.62m max, inclusive of units)The newly installed kitchen has a pleasant double aspect and is at the heart of the home. It has a range of cream open wood shaker style fitted wall and base units and has an integrated electric Zanussi oven and hob. It also features a stone fireplace within which is the multi fuel burner that runs the central heating and hot water.The Kitchen accesses the Dining Room, perhaps offering the opportunity to create a large single show piece Kitchen.Dining room (4.22m x 2.34m)A large room accessed from the Dining Kitchen and with external access, it offers a very useful space for Dining or as a Study.Utility room (4.51m x 2.14m inclusive of WC)A useful room off the Dining Room, with new wall and base units, WC off, sink and plumbing for a washing machine with vinyl flooring and external access.Living room (3.61m x 3.47m)Accessed from the Entrance Hall this attractive room is carpeted and has a pleasing double aspectFirst Floor;Accessed from the Kitchen via the staircase;landing (3.61m x 0.93m, part only, excludes stairs)A carpeted landing with storage cupboard accessing;bedroom 1 (3.59m x 3.48m)A double bedroom with an eastern aspect offering attractive views across the Dale with storage cupboard.Bedroom 2 (not measured)A double bedroom with views over the Dale accommodating the hot water cylinder, immersion heater and airing cupboard.Bathroom (1.53m x 2.57m)Accommodating a white suite comprising a bath with shower over, pedestal sink and close coupled WC with a southerly aspect.Bedroom 3 (2.30m x 3.26m)Single bedroom that could be equally well suited to a study or music room.Bedroom 4 (1.83m x 4.63m)A double bedroom used by the vendor as a guest room with a westerly aspect and fitted wardrobe.Land and buildingsThe Cottage is accessed along a private winding stoned drive. Surfaced paths surround the Cottage together with attractive flower borders.The property benefits from a range of outbuildings and these are summarised below;Three bay car port/garage (9.45m x 4.7m gea)Four bay timber frame general purpose agricultural building with concrete floor, electric and water with box profile roof cladding. This also benefits from an adjoining sheep dip.Large stone shippon (3.76m x 8.22 gia) with neighbouring corn store and block and corrugated sheet implement shed.The land totals 5.8 acres and surrounds the Cottage and is primarily grass fields with some mixed broadleaf woodland to the rear of the property. The extent of the property is shown edged red and hatched green on the plan supplied.If required a further 10.7 acres is available by way of separate negotiation and this is shown edged and hatched blue on the plan.Whilst not offered as part of the sale, the 3.19 ac woodland between the two blocks of land has been grazed and used by the vendors for many years creating a ring fenced holding.The eligible land is registered for Single Farm Payment, and entitlements are available if required. The land is also subject to an Entry Level Stewardship Scheme that ends in 2015.DirectionsWhen travelling on the main A623 road from Tideswell towards Sparrowpit, after entering Peak Forest, at the traffic lights turn right. Fees


If you wish to apply to rent a property please observe the following procedure.
Rowcliffes charge the following fees in respect of administration and references:
Single Applicant - £100 (inc vat) Two Applicants - £200 (inc vat) Each additional applicant thereafter - £100 (inc vat).
A tenancy will be offered to you subject to contract and more specifically, subject to the following conditions:
• A fully completed application form has been submitted together with the appropriate fee.
• Payment of £200 (minimum) Holding Fee to reserve the property.
• You will be asked to pay this at the same time as the Application Fee.
• The landlord has accepted the offer.
• A satisfactory search has been carried out by an independent credit referencing agency (details on request).
• Satisfactory references have been obtained.
If your application is rejected prior to acceptance and/or seeking references, all monies are refundable. If your application is accepted (subject to references) you will be required to pay a minimum of £200 as a Holding Fee, upon receipt of which the property will be reserved for you. In some instances in order to reserve a property you may be asked to pay a higher Holding Fee or occasionally the full Deposit. If you are successful then upon commencement of the tenancy the Holding Fee will be used as part of your first rent payment to the landlord.
Once you have been provisionally accepted by the landlord (subject to references and contract) the Application Fee and Holding Fee (and Deposit if taken) become non-returnable unless the landlord withdraws the property due to their own unforeseen circumstances. If you choose to withdraw after acceptance, or undeclared adverse information is uncovered during referencing, then you will forfeit all fees (plus a reasonable proportion of the Deposit, if taken, which reflects the landlord's lost rent for the period between provisional acceptance and the date of rejection).
Before moving in to a property payment of the first months rent and deposit must be made by bank transfer, or cash . Funds must be cleared before keys can be released.
If in any doubt as to what is included within the let (i.E. Furniture, appliances etc.) you should seek further clarification prior to submitting your application.
You may be asked to provide a guarantor in some cases. Please note a guarantor fee of £60 (inc vat) per guarantor would then be payable.
The tenancy you are applying for is a fixed term.

From the ground floor hallway there is a pleasant and spacious lounge with a feature archway through to a substantial dining room which in turn leads to a superbly fitted and thought out kitchen. To the first floor a stunning landing leads to three well proportioned bedrooms and a fabulous bathroom. An equally stunning landing to the second floor leads to three further well proportioned bedrooms and a spacious shower room. The property benefits from off road parking for three vehicles, a spacious forecourt seating area enjoying an elevated position above the road below to the front with a further enclosed courtyard garden at the rear.

listing.description: Charming family sized double fronted stone house with excellent spacious accommodation. This oil fired centrally heated three bedroomed property has been fully restored and retains many of its original features including beamed ceilings, flagged windowsills, stone fireplaces, cheese press dated 1849, oak lintels and hardwood windows. It is situated in the idyllic Peak District village of Hollinsclough, in the upper Dove Valley, the backdrop to a number of TV programmes and films. The house commands views to front and rear of the unspoilt limestone Crome and Hollins Hills. Accommodation includes large entrance hall, two receptions, fitted kitchen and family bathroom. Lawns to front and side and a cobbled driveway with dry stone wall boundaries.Hollinsclough is a small, picturesque Peak District village, in the upper Dove valley. It is a stone built village, set amid some splendid unspoilt limestone scenery. The attractive stone houses, chapel and village hall are flanked by the remarkable peaks of Crome, Hollins and Parkhouse Hills; coral reef limestone peaks that rise gracefully to give them the appearance of mountains.The position of the village, between moorland, open hills, rivers, streams and the peaks make it a unique location for a wide variety of activities. The stunning scenery has provided the backdrop for a number of films and TV programmes including Peak Practice and films such as Pride and Prejudice.Hollinsclough had a thriving silk weaving cottage industry back in the 18th century. Material was transported by pack horse to the silk mills at Macclesfield. Several of the old pack horse bridges and footpaths remain in the area as walks, cyclepaths and bridleways.There is still a thriving school, situated behind its 19th century predecessor, the Frank Wheldon School, an imposing building topped with a wooden 'dove-cote' bell tower which once summoned the children from outlying farms to school. It is situated in the idyllic Peak District village of Hollinsclough, in the upper Dove Valley and commands views to the front and rear of the unspoilt Crome and Hollins Hill.

Fees


If you wish to apply to rent a property please observe the following procedure.
Rowcliffes charge the following fees in respect of administration and references:
Single Applicant - £100 (inc vat) Two Applicants - £200 (inc vat) Each additional applicant thereafter - £100 (inc vat).
A tenancy will be offered to you subject to contract and more specifically, subject to the following conditions:
• A fully completed application form has been submitted together with the appropriate fee.
• Payment of £200 (minimum) Holding Fee to reserve the property.
• You will be asked to pay this at the same time as the Application Fee.
• The landlord has accepted the offer.
• A satisfactory search has been carried out by an independent credit referencing agency (details on request).
• Satisfactory references have been obtained.
If your application is rejected prior to acceptance and/or seeking references, all monies are refundable. If your application is accepted (subject to references) you will be required to pay a minimum of £200 as a Holding Fee, upon receipt of which the property will be reserved for you. In some instances in order to reserve a property you may be asked to pay a higher Holding Fee or occasionally the full Deposit. If you are successful then upon commencement of the tenancy the Holding Fee will be used as part of your first rent payment to the landlord.
Once you have been provisionally accepted by the landlord (subject to references and contract) the Application Fee and Holding Fee (and Deposit if taken) become non-returnable unless the landlord withdraws the property due to their own unforeseen circumstances. If you choose to withdraw after acceptance, or undeclared adverse information is uncovered during referencing, then you will forfeit all fees (plus a reasonable proportion of the Deposit, if taken, which reflects the landlord's lost rent for the period between provisional acceptance and the date of rejection).
Before moving in to a property payment of the first months rent and deposit must be made by bank transfer, or cash . Funds must be cleared before keys can be released.
If in any doubt as to what is included within the let (i.E. Furniture, appliances etc.) you should seek further clarification prior to submitting your application.
You may be asked to provide a guarantor in some cases. Please note a guarantor fee of £60 (inc vat) per guarantor would then be payable.
The tenancy you are applying for is a fixed term.
Details of our fees will be provided again within the application form Which all applicants must complete and sign as standard.

There are two sash windows to the front, laminate strip floor, central heating radiator. Stairs lead off to the first floor beneath which there is a further lobby leading to the basement workshop/hobby room. A gas fired combination condensing boiler serves the central heating and hot water system.Workshop/hobby room – 4.12m x 3.09m (13’ 6” x 10’ 2”) accessed from the living kitchen and offering opportunity for a variety of uses, hobby/study space, teenagers den or guest bedroom. listing.letting_fees:
Fees


If you wish to apply to rent a property please observe the following procedure.
Rowcliffes charge the following fees in respect of administration and references:
Single Applicant - £100 (inc vat) Two Applicants - £200 (inc vat) Each additional applicant thereafter - £100 (inc vat).
A tenancy will be offered to you subject to contract and more specifically, subject to the following conditions:
• A fully completed application form has been submitted together with the appropriate fee.
• Payment of £200 (minimum) Holding Fee to reserve the property.
• You will be asked to pay this at the same time as the Application Fee.
• The landlord has accepted the offer.
• A satisfactory search has been carried out by an independent credit referencing agency (details on request).
• Satisfactory references have been obtained.
If your application is rejected prior to acceptance and/or seeking references, all monies are refundable. If your application is accepted (subject to references) you will be required to pay a minimum of £200 as a Holding Fee, upon receipt of which the property will be reserved for you. In some instances in order to reserve a property you may be asked to pay a higher Holding Fee or occasionally the full Deposit. If you are successful then upon commencement of the tenancy the Holding Fee will be used as part of your first rent payment to the landlord.
Once you have been provisionally accepted by the landlord (subject to references and contract) the Application Fee and Holding Fee (and Deposit if taken) become non-returnable unless the landlord withdraws the property due to their own unforeseen circumstances. If you choose to withdraw after acceptance, or undeclared adverse information is uncovered during referencing, then you will forfeit all fees (plus a reasonable proportion of the Deposit, if taken, which reflects the landlord's lost rent for the period between provisional acceptance and the date of rejection).
Before moving in to a property payment of the first months rent and deposit must be made by bank transfer, or cash . Funds must be cleared before keys can be released.
If in any doubt as to what is included within the let (i.E. Furniture, appliances etc.) you should seek further clarification prior to submitting your application.
You may be asked to provide a guarantor in some cases. Please note a guarantor fee of £60 (inc vat) per guarantor would then be payable.
The tenancy you are applying for is a fixed term.
Details of our fees will be provided again within the application form Which all applicants must complete and sign as standard.
